stringtable.string: TOM SIMPKINS: It's good to see you again after all these years, sire. This time too, I have been chosen to provide you with advice and support. Oh, these memories of our rich battles against Lord Barkley...
TOM SIMPKINS: But I'm afraid we won't have time to reminisce! Dark shadows have appeared once again and threaten the empire and its inhabitants!
TOM SIMPKINS: I'm afraid it's up to you to banish the terrors once again. But you're a little rusty when it comes to running a castle.
TOM SIMPKINS: Let me explain to you the new elements of the interface.
TOM SIMPKINS: This view shows the social resources. You use them to research technologies, unlock new ranks and make your people happy.

TOM SIMPKINS: {scarlet}Honor{white} represents your popularity among the nobility. It is necessary to train troops, raise the noble to a higher rank and many other things. Magnificent buildings, ornamental buildings and various measures are honorable to you.

TOM SIMPKINS: {scarlet}Popularity{white} indicates your popularity among the people. If the popularity falls, you will soon be alone in the castle! Supply, tax, crime control and effects of some special buildings influence popularity.
TOM SIMPKINS: {scarlet}Knowledge{white} allows the exploration of technologies. It is generated in your educational institutions. Your scholars work tirelessly to give you one advantage.
TOM SIMPKINS: If you have achieved enough honor and meet the conditions for promotion, you can raise your noble {scarlet} to a higher rank {white} here.

TOM SIMPKINS: Be sure to provide for your people {scarlet}{white} or they will quickly become dissatisfied. The costs of house and farm are reduced in this game mode. {scarlet}Expansion{white} allows you to gain popularity and honor more quickly.

TOM SIMPKINS: This meter shows how many people live under your rule. All of your taxable workers and also lousy criminals are part of your population. {scarlet}Expand the castle or build outposts,{white} to be able to accommodate more people.

TOM SIMPKINS: Servants are unfree and count as the property of your noble. {scarlet} They will also occupy population space. {white} The number of servants you can own {scarlet} increases with each additional title your noble achieves.

TOM SIMPKINS: Here you can see how strong your army is and how big it can still become. All agents, soldiers and cannons count as military. {scarlet} Expand the castle or build recruitment buildings,{white} to increase your army strength.
TOM SIMPKINS: The payday clock shows you how long you have to wait until the next money.
TOM SIMPKINS: It doesn't just tell the time until payday. Here you can also see {scarlet}how popularity and honor will change. {white} You can see more details if you hold down CTRL.
TOM SIMPKINS: On {scarlet}payday{white} your popularity and honor will be calculated! Festivals, sermons and some constructed buildings will grant bonuses {scarlet}immedaitly{white} after.
TOM SIMPKINS: Here, as usual, you will find your idle servants.
TOM SIMPKINS: Likewise, you can also locate your troops. In addition, the tooltip of each button shows how much wages you spend on the unit type.
TOM SIMPKINS: Now let's take a look inside the castle.
TOM SIMPKINS: Please select the castle now!
TOM SIMPKINS: The castle now has two views. In addition to the usual one, there is also a second one that enables you to take measures.
TOM SIMPKINS: This tab displays your treasury. Here you set taxes, buy servants and receive information about income and expenses.
TOM SIMPKINS: This tab switches to banquets. Lavish celebrations cost you lots of money but your honor will benefit from this.
TOM SIMPKINS: Unlike what you're used to, you can stop taxes immediately. But be careful, {scarlet}because the mob won't like high taxes!

TOM SIMPKINS: This button allows you to set {scarlet}collection points {white}. Troops produced in buildings will run to the position. In the case of the castle, servants {scarlet} will automatically mine resources.
TOM SIMPKINS: You place a rally point {scarlet}by right-clicking on the game world after the mouse becomes a hand with a flag. {white} This only works if the position is reachable.
TOM SIMPKINS: Give it a try! To set a collection point, you have to right-click on a position that can be reached from the building.
TOM SIMPKINS: Well done! Future trained servants will go to the marked position!

TOM SIMPKINS: Now it's time to choose your noble. {scarlet} You can't obtain new ranks without a noble! {white}If the noble falls in battle, {scarlet} you will find him or her in front of your castle.
TOM SIMPKINS: Open the menu and choose a noble! To pass this introduction, it is irrelevant which noble you choose.
TOM SIMPKINS: Every noble has different characteristics. You would do well to choose a noble {scarlet}that suits your play style. {white} Everyone has individual advantages over the others.
TOM SIMPKINS: Jump to the banquets so I can explain them to you as well.
TOM SIMPKINS: These are the different levels of banquets available to you. Once you have gained enough influence and accumulated gold, a festival will be held and your honor will be increased.
TOM SIMPKINS: How quickly you can take action is determined by your influence.{scarlet} Influence increases faster with each new title you achieve.
TOM SIMPKINS: Now turn to %s and select %s! We've kept the scouts waiting long enough!
TOM SIMPKINS: You've received your first captain. The light cavalry should not be underestimated!
TOM SIMPKINS: Select the squad to continue!
TOM SIMPKINS: Here you can give direct orders to the soldiers as usual.
TOM SIMPKINS: If the captain's soldiers fall, you can use this button to recruit new soldiers at a corresponding building. {scarlet} You can fill up the squad with CTRL.
TOM SIMPKINS: Here you can see the captain's experience.{scarlet} Experienced captains lead their troops better.
TOM SIMPKINS: This meter indicates the captain's health.
TOM SIMPKINS: On this line you can see which activity your unit is doing and how much endurance they have.

TOM SIMPKINS: Endurance determinates {scarlet}how well a unit fairs in battle.{white} The Endurance is stated by the little face. The happier it is, the more endurance is left. Your noble {scarlet}will not be affected by endurance.

TOM SIMPKINS: Activities provide information about whether a unit exhaust or replenish their endurance. {scarlet}If the unit stands still, their endurance is regenerating. If it is running or fighting endurance is consumed.{white} Your serfs also consume endurance when they are working.
TOM SIMPKINS: You can order all of your units at once to march instead of run. They will move not as fast, {scarlet}but they will not get tired.
TOM SIMPKINS: Diese Zahlen geben die Truppenst채rke an. Fast alle Milit채reinheiten und Kerberos verf체gen 체ber Soldaten.
TOM SIMPKINS: These numbers indicate troop strength. Almost all military units and Kerberos have soldiers.
TOM SIMPKINS: Here you can see the squad's defense. It will reduce damage taken.
TOM SIMPKINS: Attack power indicates the damage a squad can deal. The attack power is offset against the armor of the attack target.
TOM SIMPKINS: And finally, maintenance. Your units will require different amounts of pay. The maintenance depends on {scarlet}the type of troops.
TOM SIMPKINS: Of course you can release troops when you no longer need them.
TOM SIMPKINS: It is time for me to explain how to manage your castle.

TOM SIMPKINS: Your buildings are still being constructed by serfs. Some buildings are tied to a title. {scarlet} You can see the conditions in the tooltip. {white} Similarly, technologies and other elements are tied to the title.
TOM SIMPKINS: Buy more serfs until you have at least 18 of them! Assign them tasks as you see fit.
TOM SIMPKINS: Not far from your castle, there is a clay deposit. Lets start by mining it. Build a clay pit at the marked location!

TOM SIMPKINS: Look, the miners are coming to the castle. But what is this? They are not satisfied! If this continues, they will leave very quickly! Do not make the mistake of underestimating the common folk!
TOM SIMPKINS: Quickly, provide them with house and home! If they can fill their bellies and rest their weary bones, they will be more satisfied.
TOM SIMPKINS: That looks better! In farms, taverns, and residences, you can make adjustments that {scarlet} affect popularity and honor, but also impact the stamina of the workers!
TOM SIMPKINS: Try to balance the deductions to popularity on payday and attract a total of 15 workers (not serfs)!
TOM SIMPKINS: The new workers bring fresh gold into your citys coffers. Finances that you will sorely need to raise troops. But as a regular noble, you can only arm your serfs and recruit spearmen.
TOM SIMPKINS: Elevate your noble to the rank of Castellan!
TOM SIMPKINS: Each rank brings new rights and duties. For the noble, an additional ability can be chosen at each rank: {scarlet}Castellan, Baron, and Duke.{white}
TOM SIMPKINS: Now select your castle and unlock a new ability for the noble!
TOM SIMPKINS: The people will be increasingly difficult to satisfy. {scarlet}Soon you will have to deal with law enforcement and pest control!

TOM SIMPKINS: Workers will {scarlet}break the law.{white} Failing to catch criminals quickly {scarlet}ruins your popularity! {white}Try to catch them quickly. {scarlet}Have armed serfs patrol or build watchtowers!
TOM SIMPKINS: The noble can also catch criminals. {scarlet}For this, you must send the noble to hunt down these criminal elements.
TOM SIMPKINS: To get rid of rats, {scarlet}you must upgrade your watchtowers to falconry towers.{white} A falcon can keep a large area around the tower clean.
TOM SIMPKINS: Next, you should build a chapel. In houses of worship, you can hold services, {scarlet}which cost you gold but increase your popularity!
TOM SIMPKINS: Now elevate your noble to the next higher rank.
TOM SIMPKINS: Your Grace, if we continue like this, we will soon have no room for more subjects. You should next expand the castle!
TOM SIMPKINS: Now build a university. As I explained before, scholars produce essential knowledge without which you cannot research!

TOM SIMPKINS: Have you noticed that this is a good spot for fortifications like palisades or walls? {scarlet}Palisades and walls can only be built on these construction sites.{white} Keep this in mind.
TOM SIMPKINS: Excellent! Now the most important buildings should be present to kickstart your economy. But do not forget to build more buildings and continue promoting your noble.
TOM SIMPKINS: Soldiers are recruited in barracks and similar buildings. Build a barracks to recruit your own troops!
TOM SIMPKINS: Wonderful! Through the barracks you are now in a position to recruit your first soldiers. They are weak but cheap and can be thrown into battle en masse.
TOM SIMPKINS: Recruit 3 squads of soldiers!

TOM SIMPKINS: Because you now call a recruitment building your own, {scarlet}you are now able to build a mercenary camp. {white}In the mercenary camp, {scarlet}you can hire special troops of other Nobles for a hefty surcharge. {white}However, you still have to meet the recruitment requirements.
TOM SIMPKINS: You'll need your new troops soon. {scarlet}The highwaymen have taken notice of us and are planning an attack on your castle! {white}The opportunity to apply what you have learned!
TOM SIMPKINS: Look, a province! Build an outpost to gain sovereignty over land. {scarlet}Provinces increase your army size and grant additional effects. {white}Secure them as quickly as possible.
TOM SIMPKINS: Capture the province to see what bonus it has in store for you!

TOM SIMPKINS: Your Highness, one of your men has stumbeled into an enemies trap. Those contraptions are belonging to the most treacherous weapons in a Nobles arsenal! {scarlet}You can uncover traps with your thieves!
TOM SIMPKINS: Maybe you should consider traps too. {scarlet}Serfs can build traps. The traps will be hidden from the enemy. {white}But if Sir William is happening to ask, I didn't told you that.
TOM SIMPKINS: Look, we have discovered hidden resources! You can not exploit this resources right away, Your Highness.
TOM SIMPKINS: To make those resources usable, {scarlet}you have to research Blasting in your tavern and then send a scout.
TOM SIMPKINS: Congratulations, Your Honor! You have successfully mastered the introduction to {scarlet}Stronghold {white}. You can now end the game or complete the mission.
TOM SIMPKINS: No matter what you decide, I will now throw lime kilns down from the South Sea island and then spread myself there! Have a good time, Highness!
